TEST DESCRIPTION: Evaluate how the sexual division of labor differs among human hunter-gatherer societies compared to other species.
PRECONDITIONS: Knowledge of hunter-gatherer lifestyles and food acquisition patterns.

TEST DATA.context: Sexual division of labour (SDL) is the delegation of different tasks between the male and female members of a species...
TEST DATA.question: What is the sexual division of labor (SDL) and how does it differ among human hunter-gatherer societies compared to other species?
TEST DATA.expected_answer: The Sexual Division of Labor (SDL) refers to the delegation of different tasks between male and female members of a species...

TEST STEPS: Analyze the gender-based division of labor in hunter-gatherer societies.
Compare SDL in humans with other species.
EXPECTED RESULT: A clear understanding of the combined food acquisition and sharing model unique to humans.

TEST DESCRIPTION: Evaluate the historical perspective on gendered roles in hunter-gatherer societies and identify key anthropologists.
PRECONDITIONS: Familiarity with anthropological studies on early human societies.

TEST DATA.context: From the 1970s onward, the dominant paleontological perspective of gendered roles in hunter-gatherer societies was of a model...
TEST DATA.question: What is the historical perspective on gendered roles in hunter-gatherer societies, as highlighted in the text, and who were the anthropologists who coined this perspective?
TEST DATA.expected_answer: The historical perspective on gendered roles in hunter-gatherer societies was primarily a model termed 'Man the Hunter, Woman the Gatherer'...

TEST STEPS: Identify anthropologists who proposed the theory.
Compare it with modern research findings.
EXPECTED RESULT: Understanding of the 'Man the Hunter, Woman the Gatherer' model and its critiques.
